intro: Hieracium laevigatum subsp. purpurellum, commonly known as the purple hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow with purple markings, and it produces small, elongated achenes as its seeds. It thrives in meadows, pastures, and disturbed soils, often forming dense colonies.
